The award recognizes the out
standing college radio station in

NEW YORK-George D. Car
roll took the advice Of Horace
Greeley and a friend. He went
west and found bonanza.


Carroll, a native of Brooklyn
is now a resident of Richmond,
Calf, and the towns first Ne
gro mayor.


Carroll Is the first lawyer to
become mayor Of Richmond.
town of $4,000 persons, 81 per-
cent of them Negroes.


with the continued rapid flow
of whites into the suburbs" says
Carroll, -FOUR urban areas may
we'll become predominantly Ne
gro and Spanish. And Negro
mayor will not be rarity"


If Washington were not fed
orally controlled, he is sure that
it would have a Negro mayor.


Richmond is currently in the
throes of downtown redevelop-
ment project. Commencing ofthe
project depends on interpreta-
ton of a federal assistance law.
If the law is decided in Rich
monds favor, then the project
will go ahead, "and Richmond will
60 ahead" says Carroll.

munications Center, has been
